## Type of Change

Please delete options that are not relevant.

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] Documentation update
- [ ] Code refactoring
- [ ] Performance improvement
- [ ] Test updates
- [ ] CI/CD changes
- [ ] Dependency updates

## Checklist

Before submitting your PR, please review and check all the following:

### Code Quality
- [ ] My code follows the style guidelines of this project (PEP 8)
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings
- [ ] I have removed any debug code or print statements

### Testing
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] I have tested this on multiple browsers (if frontend changes)

### Documentation
- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [ ] I have updated the README.md (if needed)
- [ ] I have updated the CHANGELOG.md
- [ ] My changes include docstrings for new functions/classes

### Database
- [ ] I have created/updated migrations for model changes
- [ ] Migrations are reversible
- [ ] I have tested migrations on a clean database

### Security
- [ ] My changes do not introduce security vulnerabilities
- [ ] I have not committed sensitive data (secrets, passwords, API keys)
- [ ] I have validated and sanitized user inputs (if applicable)

### Dependencies
- [ ] I have updated requirements.txt (if I added new dependencies)
- [ ] New dependencies are necessary and well-maintained
- [ ] I have specified version constraints for new dependencies

## Breaking Changes

If this PR includes breaking changes, please describe:

- What breaks?
- Why is this necessary?
- Migration path for users

Add any additional notes or context about the PR here.
